Candidate :  Federico Folco  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   France - Paris  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
Philosophiae Doctorate  
Date ( from – to): January 2010 – January 2013  
Philosophiae Doctorate in Industrial Chemistry, awarded the 12th of April 2013. Institution: Department 
of Industrial Chemistry and Materials, University of Bologna (ITA), in partnership with Lonza Ltd (CH). 
Thesis T itle: “Catalytic Processes for the Transformation of Ethanol into Acetonitrile”. Supervisor: Prof. 
Fabrizio Cavani.  
 
Date (from – to): September –December 2012 Institution Visiting scholar at ARC Centre of Excellence 
for Functional Nanomaterials, Australian  Institute of Bioengineering and Nanotechnology, The 
University of Queensland, Brisbane (AU).  
Role, Topic: Visiting scholar, “Ammoxidation of Glycerol to Acrylonitrile”. Supervisor Prof. George 
Beltramini.  
 
Master Degree  
Date (from – to): September 2007 – July 2009  
Name of the Degree: Master Degree in Products Materials and Processes for the Industrial Chemistry, 
awarded the 17th of July 2009.  
Institution: Department of Industrial Chemistry and Materials, University of Bologna (ITA). Thesis Title 
“Role of Su pport on V/P/O Based Catalysts for the Oxidation of n -Butane to Maleic Anhydride”. 
Supervisor: Prof. Fabrizio Cavani. Overall Mark: 107/110.  
 
Bachelor Degree  
Date (from – to): September 2003 – July 2007  
Name of the Degree: Bachelor Degree in Industrial Chem istry, awarded the 20th of July 2007.  
Institution: Faculty of Industrial Chemistry, University of Bologna (ITA). Thesis Title “Brazing alloys 
Production: Analysis and Control Process”. Supervisor Prof. Domenica Tonelli. Overall Mark 99/110.  
 
Languages  
Italian (Native)  
English (Fluent)  
French (Fluent)  
 
 
 CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
2020 to present AXENS S. A. 
Position : Catalyst Tech nologist  
Area: Refinery/Petrochemical   
• Draw up of technical proposal into hydroprocess field (HDS, HDN, HDO, Grading, Adsorbents, 
Internals, etc. )  
• Technical assistance & Consulting - Provide Technical Services onsite for refineries (catalyst 
loadin g, activation and start -up)  
• Market oriented development of new digital/on -line solutions  
• Knowledge of oil refining and conversion to fuel and petrochemicals  
• Collaborations with R&D center  
• Team working  
 
2014 – 2019 POLYNT Spa  
 
2017 – 2019 R&D Catalyst Manager  
Area: Petrochemical/Po lymers  
• R&D Manager and Team Leader (12 people team)  
• Deep knowledge of oxidation catalyst and processes  
• Technical, manufacturing and QC management  
• Worldwide proven expertise in industrial start -up operations and full technical assistance in 
cataly tic oxidation field  
• Strong experience of scale -up operations from bench through pilot to industrial  
• Deep knowledge of anhydrides and derivatives production  
• Collaborations with Universities  
• Proven IP production  
• Excellent computer skills  
 
2014 – 2017 Project Leader R&D Catalyst  
Area: Petrochemical/Polymers  
Research and development of gas phase heterogeneous catalysts. Cross -knowledge to design and to 
perform laboratory tests from the early stages of research (micro reactor tests and physic -chemical 
characterization) to pilot plant tests. Partnership with universities. Scale up/down knowledge. Team 
leading attitude . 
 
2013 – 2014 Consorzio CIRCC  
Position: Post Doctoral Rese archer  
“Catalytic Processes for the Transformation of Renewable Raw Material to Chemicals”  
 
Sept – Nov 2007 Pietro Gallian i S.p.A.  
Position: Quality and process control.  
Area: Metallurgic, Brazing Alloys  
 
 
 COMMENT  
 
Informatics And Technical Abilities  
• Hardware Knowledge: Outstanding.  
• Operating Systems Knowl edge: Windows, Linux, Macintosh, DOS, Android.  
• Software Knowledge: Very good (MS Office, Openoffice, Lotus123, Origin).  
• Chemical Software Knowledge: Very good (Spectrum, ChemDrow, Panalytical X’pert, MDL 
ISIS, GC Chemstation, CASA XPS).  
• Technical abilities : Synthesis and characterization of organic and inorganic catalytic materials. 
Design, set -up and management of chemical lab scale plants for dangerous substances and 
chemical reac

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
